lines.text: Y'know, sometimes volcanic eruptions can cause nearby bodies of water to turn red.
Wait, what?
The nitrogen-rich ash gets into the water, and it causes certain species of algae to bloom...
And that red algae gets so thick in the water, it looks like blood!
What're you sayin'?
Well, maybe it's not blood- they mixed the ash with water from the tub's faucet, and it caused a red algal bloom!
Then he poured that fake algae blood all over himself!
...Huh. That's... kinda plausi-
Are you joking, Fleini?
Our city's tap water isn't... the best, but it cer-certainly doesn't contain algae in those concentrations.
And even if it did, merely mixing in ash wouldn't s-suffice to trigger a... miniature red tide effect.
It's- it's completely ridiculous.
Man, why should we listen to you? Aren't you trying to psyche us out?
Th-that- that may be...
I m-mean- it certainly isn't the case, and I'm innocent of any wr-wr-wrongdoing...!
Uh-huh.
But- but, this is more in the category of mocking you for your ignorance.
The idea is- it's impossible, and- you're just going to...
...Actually, no, I'd love to see you try to argue that at my disciplinary hearing. Be my guest.
Ugh. Seeker... there's another angle, here. Try something else.
